node.title: Grampians Peaks Trail opens as hikers question its steep price tag
node.alt: A man with a dark beard and shirt in an Akubra stares at the camera. he is sitting on a tree branch on a flowing creek bed.
node.description: A new long-distance walk opens in Victoria's west, but is it worth the $33 million it cost to build?
node.content:
["As a boy, the Witches\u00a0Cauldron was Rodney Thompson's favourite haunt.\u00a0", "The local of Wartook, on the edge of western Victoria's Grampians National Park, would regularly climb the mountain range to reach the isolated cave.", "\"This is an area where locals have spent a lot of time over the years,\" he says.", "\"We used to know it as the Dead Bullock Falls, but we know there's an Indigenous name for the area.", "\"We all liked to walk to it because it's beautiful and untouched.", "Now 47, Mr Thompson will share his secret with thousands of people, as campsites connecting a huge walk the length of the national park officially open today.", "For a man who has spent his life in the region looking after the walking tracks and the environment, it's a day of mixed emotions.", "", "
Grampians Peaks Trail(Supplied: Parks Victoria)
", "
A whole new kind of tourist
", "The Grampians Peaks Trail is now open after six years of construction and more than $33 million of investment from the state and federal governments.", "Dozens of construction workers have laid 97 kilometres of new trail\u00a0along with accommodation huts, 11 hike-in campgrounds, and trailheads\u00a0almost doubling the number of walking tracks in Victoria's fourth-largest national park.", "A large portion of the remaining 63 kilometres of the track has been upgraded.", "With the trail, Parks Victoria says it hopes to appeal to first-time and part-time walkers beyond the more hardcore regular visitors.", "Mr Thompson has been a member of Friends of Grampians Gariwerd since the area was declared a national park in 1984.", "The group works to involve the community in conserving the walking tracks and natural environment.", "", "
Mr Thompson is urging visitors to take their rubbish with them and to respect the local environment.(ABC Ballarat: Rhiannon Stevens)
", "Construction has involved removing 14.4 hectares of native bushland, and it is this aspect of commercialising the trail that is the source of Mr Thompson's conflicted feelings and those of his colleagues.", "\"As an organisation, we believe commercial projects should always be outside the park\u00a0and the park itself should be for conservation and education more than anything else,\" Mr Thompson says.", "Around 35,000 walkers are expected to visit the Grampians annually by 2025, adding more than $6 million to the local economy. The park is already the third-most visited in Victoria.", "", "
The Grampians is already a popular tourist spot.(ABC News: Lauren Day)
", "Victoria's Environment Minister Lily D'Ambrosio says the protections in the national park are \"very strong\".", "\"Working across jurisdictions, we've made sure any disturbance has been more than compensated for by offsets in other parts of the state, including ensuring we go for similar classes and values of vegetation,\" she says.", "\"We are investing in other areas of the park, through tourism [and]\u00a0as a result of the bushfires.\"", "In the 2020 Victorian budget, the state government committed $7.8 million to upgrade McKenzie Falls, another popular Grampians destination, and $58 million for the Brambuk Aboriginal Cultural Heritage Centre at Halls Gap.", "
Jobs creation
", "The trail runs for 160 kilometres from Mount Zero\u00a0near Horsham\u00a0in the north\u00a0to Dunkeld in the south.", "Halls Gap is the only town along the Peaks Trail, meaning hikers have nowhere to stock up on supplies for the first or last eight days of the full trip.", "This has created a business opportunity locals are looking to take advantage of.", "Adrian Manikas has set up the Grampians Peaks Walking Company to cater for the demand with food drops, adding to his existing rock climbing business in Halls Gap.", "", "
Adrian Manikas is preparing to hire up to eight new tour guides and trainees in the next year.(Supplied: Adrian Manikas)
", "\"You do have to walk the trail from north to south if you are camping overnight, and there's a transport service based out of Halls that can take you to the start of the walk and then pick you up from the end and bring you back.\"", "A registered Aboriginal group hopes the trail will lead to improved economic opportunities for Indigenous residents as well.", "", "
A walker looks out across the Grampians National Park in Victoria's east.(Supplied: Chris O'Connell)
", "
A bit rich?
", "Some hikers have raised concerns that the $47.70 per plot per night's camping fees make the 13-day hike too expensive.", "But Parks Victoria chair John Pandazopoulos says it's an appropriate rate.", "No less than 1,400 reservations have been made at Peaks Trail campgrounds since they opened on October 28.", "
A necessary sacrifice?
", "Notwithstanding his reservations, Mr Thompson says the trail has \"set a new standard\" for sustainable construction in Victoria.", "He is particularly impressed with workers learning old rock-cracking techniques to turn locally sourced sandstone into stepping stones.", "Mr Thompson says the full trail rivals walks such as the Appalachian Trail in the US \u2014\u00a0the world's longest hiking footpath spanning 3,500 kilometres \u2014\u00a0for its ability to attract walkers of all levels of skill and creature comforts.", "\"On the whole, I think they've done it pretty well,\" he says."]
